column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=DS : Is arson a lesser of two evils proposition for you , then ?
#Text=IN :
#Text=Yes , absolutely .

#Text=Because if the buildings are standing , if the slaughterhouse is standing , then the amount of pain and suffering — I mean , why would you preserve it just so someone can make a profit by continuing to hurt and kill individuals who feel every bit as much as we do ?
#Text=Newkirk on humans and other animals
#Text=DS : A critic would say that there is no equating humans with animals .
#Text=That by stopping research that saves lives based upon these animals you are valuing chickens or mice over people .
#Text=IN :
#Text=I think it hokum .
#Text=Total hokum .
#Text=First , you ca n’t have it both ways .
#Text=They are either like us or not like us .
#Text=You ’re using them because they ’re like us , then recognize the ways they are like us .
#Text=They are afraid to be in the cages .
#Text=The cages are tiny and uncomfortable and miserable .
#Text=They are frightened .
#Text=They are not treated well in the course of being experimented on .
#Text=It ’s not as if it is just a few of them being used in life-saving experiments .
#Text=There are millions being used every year for fool things , including , still , nicotine and cocaine experiments .
#Text=You know nicotine is bad for you .
#Text=Every little single thing is done to them .
#Text=But , on the other hand , they ’re not like us physiologically in many ways that are important , which is what makes these tests invariably unscientific .
#Text=You ca n’t extrapolate from a mouse to a man .
#Text=They have a different metabolism .
#Text=They have a very different physiology .
#Text=DS : Like the saccharine experiments , which were ridiculous because they showed it causes cancer in mice when you inject them with eight times their body weight daily with saccharine .
#Text=We are n’t mice , and who consumes such amounts ?
#Text=IN :

#Text=Yes ! People are scared , and experimenters who still use animals are only a percentage of all the people who do research in the U.S. The other research fields are more profitable in terms of applicability ; human clinical work , epidemiological work , computer mapping work , all those things where you use human data , all those researchers are doing more productive work .
#Text=Cloning
#Text=human skin , putting human DNA on the Internet .
#Text=This is where the money should be going .
#Text=Not doing things you did five hundred years ago by stuffing chemicals down animals ’ throats , or performing some procedure that you later find out does n’t even work on human beings .
#Text=DS : Do you think blocking stem cell research is something that harms animals ?
#Text=IN :
#Text=Yes , absolutely , if it ’s human stem cell research , we ’re in favor of it .
#Text=If you are religiously opposed to abortion , you do not have to take stem cells from the unabortus .
#Text=You can take stem cells in other ways such as from the placenta or a live birth .
#Text=You can do other things .
#Text=You do n’t have to violate your religious principles if that ’s the problem .
